register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also holds 1 status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3MAIN1_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3_MAIN1 clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from L3_MAIN1 domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having INTRCONN master port(s).

bitfield.description: Size of sliding window used to monitor INTRCONN interface activity for determination of auto-sleep feature. Time unit defined byCM_DYN_DEP_PRESCAL register.
Dynamic dependency towards WKUPAON clock domain Read 1: Dependency is enabled
Dynamic dependency towards L4_CFG clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_MAIN2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards EMIF clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards ABE clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register manages the L3_MAIN1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3, any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also holds 1 status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3MAIN2_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3_MAIN2 clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain dependencies from L3_MAIN2 domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having INTERCONN master port(s).

bitfield.description: Size of sliding window used to monitor INTRCONN interface activity for determination of auto-sleep feature. Time unit defined byCM_DYN_DEP_PRESCAL register.
Dynamic dependency towards L4SEC clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L4_PER clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards GPU clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards CAM clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards DSS clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_MAIN1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards IVA clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards IPU clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register manages the L3_MAIN2 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the GPMC clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is temporarily disabled by SW. Interconnect access to module are stalled. Can be used to change timing parameter of GPMC module.

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the OCMC_RAM clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also holds 1 status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the IPU_CLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the IPU clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the static domain dependencies from IPU domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having system initiator(s).

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards WKUPAON clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards DMA_SYSTEM clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L3_MAIN2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

Dependency is enabled

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards DSP clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from IPU domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having INTRCONN master port(s).

bitfield.description: Size of sliding window used to monitor INTRCONN interface activity for determination of auto-sleep feature. Time unit defined byCM_DYN_DEP_PRESCAL register.
Dynamic dependency towards CAM clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_MAIN2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register manages the IPU clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also holds 1 status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3_DMA_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the DMA_SYSTEM clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from DMA_SYSTEM domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having INTRCONN master port(s).

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_MAIN2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

register.description: This register manages the DMA_SYSTEM clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the EMIF_PHY_GCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DLL_GCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the EMIF_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the EMIF clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. register.description: This register manages the EMIF1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is temporarily disabled by SW. OCP access to module are stalled. Can be used to change timing parameter of EMIF_1 module.

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the EMIF2 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is temporarily disabled by SW. Interconnect access to module are stalled. Can be used to change timing parameter of EMIF2 module.

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the DLL clock.

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled. DLL_CLK can be gated when EMIF domain performs sleep transition
Optional functional clock is enabled. DLL_CLK is garantied to not be gated if already running.

Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion

register.description: This register manages the CTRL_MODULE_BANDGAP clock.

bitfield.description: Selects the divider value for generating the Thermal Sensor clock from WKUPAON_ICLK source. The divider has to be selected so as to guarantee a frequency between 1MHz and 2MHz.

bitenum.description: Divide by 8
Divide by 16
Divide by 32

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER4_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER3_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER11_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER10_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4PER_L4_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L4PER clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from L4PER domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having OCP master port(s).

bitfield.description: Size of sliding window used to monitor INTERCONN interface activity for determination of auto-sleep feature. Time unit defined byCM_DYN_DEP_PRESCAL register.
Dynamic dependency towards L4SEC clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards DSS clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3INIT clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register manages the TIMER10 clocks.

bitfield.description: Select the source of the functional clock

bitenum.description: Selects the SYS_CLK as the source
Selects the 32KHz as the source

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only INTERCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including INTERCONN

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any INTERCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the TIMER11 clocks.

bitfield.description: Select the source of the functional clock

bitenum.description: Selects the SYS_CLK as the source
Selects the 32KHz as the source

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the ELM clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the GPIO2 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4_SECURE_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3_SECURE_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L4SEC clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register controls the static domain depedencies from L4SEC domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having system initiator(s).

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4PER clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L3MAIN2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L3MAIN1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards EMIF clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from L4SEC domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having OCP master port(s).

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3MAIN2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

register.description: This register manages the AES1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any INTERCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the AES2 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including INTERCONN

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any INTERCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any INTERCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the DES3DES clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the FPKA clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the DMA_CRYPTO clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is in standby
Module is functional (not in standby)

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.
